Returns: a string representation of this object.
toString().Description: Constructs a string representation of this Proxy. This String is constructed by calling toString() on its type and concatenating " @ " and the toString() result from its address if its type is not DIRECT.

Returns: a Type representing the proxy type

Parameters: Proxy.Type: the Type of the proxy
SocketAddress: the SocketAddress for that proxy
Throws: when the type and the address are incompatible
Proxy(java.net.Proxy.Type,java.net.Socke.Description: Creates an entry representing a PROXY connection. Certain combinations are illegal. For instance, for types Http, and Socks, a SocketAddress Use the Proxy.NO_PROXY constant for representing a direct connection.

Returns: true if the objects are the same; false otherwise.
Parameters: Object: the object to compare against.
equals(java.lang.Object).Description: Compares this object against the specified object. The result is true if and only if the argument is not null and it represents the same proxy as this object. Two instances of Proxy represent the same address if both the SocketAddresses and type are equal.

Returns: a hash code value for this Proxy.
hashCode().Description: Returns a hashcode for this Proxy.

Parameters: Proxy.Type: the Type of the proxy
SocketAddress: the SocketAddress for that proxy
Throws: when the type and the address are incompatible
Proxy(java.net.Proxy.Type, java.net.Sock.Description: Creates an entry representing a PROXY connection. Certain combinations are illegal. For instance, for types Http, and Socks, a SocketAddress Use the Proxy.NO_PROXY constant for representing a direct connection.

Returns: a SocketAddress representing the socket end point of the proxy
address().Description: Returns the socket address of the proxy, or null if its a direct connection.

ClassDesc: This class represents a proxy setting, typically a type (http, socks) and a socket address. A Proxy is an immutable object.
